0.5.sentence: I have full custody of my 3 teenage daughters. I had to have blunt, direct conversations with them about EVERYTHING. First you need to know and accept a few things. 1. He is going to masturbate. Get over it. Don't try to catch him, and don't shame him. 2. He will watch porn. It's too easy to access to avoid it. If that offends you, you need to talk to him about porn. Not specifics, but don't shame him for wanting to see naked women and learn how sec works. 3. When he gets to be about 13 or 14 you need to show him how to properly use a condom. You're not authorizing use, just being safe. Be scientific about it, so nobody is embarrassed. 4. When you teach him to shave, don't use a pink razor or pink shaving cream. 5. When you take him clothes shopping, don't physically check the fit on him yourself. Ask him if they fit. 6. Acne sucks, teach him to wash his face but don't use girly soap. 7. Take him to get his hair cut. Take him to places designed for men. Sports clips, knockouts, or a barber. Not a hair salon. 8. Don't give him girly chores (don't split hairs here you know what I mean). Have him now the yard, take out the trash, pick up after the dog... the gross stuff. 9. Teach him to respect women other than you in a romantic sense. 10. Stop being overly physically affectionate. No more cuddles or him sleeping with you or hanging out in your bedroom or his. He needs to have a private space. Random erections (for no reason) happen. He does not need to be touching you in any capacity if they do.

1.sentence: I had a wound blister that was huuuuge after my car accident (the length of a U.S. dollar, a few inches high, and a few inches wide). My surgeon a week before surgery decided to pop it so we had some healing time. Holy crap. The amount of liquid that came out of that thing was amazing. My mom watches pimple popping videos so she was fascinated. She was less enthusiastic when it started seeping through the bandages once we got home and she had to rewrap it

0.25.sentence: > I'm a bad guy? How you feel if you live this situation? What difference would it make what I think? The fact is, you said you were uncomfortable with her being in contact with her ex's family, and she said she isn't going to change the situation and if you can't deal with it, then you should break up. You have both communicated your positions to each other. Now you have to decide if it's a deal breaker for you or not. If yes, break up. If not, then you need to learn to deal with it. For the record, I think that you are the one being unreasonable here. Why should those kids lose their godmother just because you don't want to accept that your girlfriend dated someone before she dated you?
